intro: Ranunculus auricomus subsp. lacerescens, commonly known as the ragged leaf buttercup, is a herbaceous perennial native to the western United States. It features delicate, palmate leaves with a distinctive jagged or frayed appearance, giving it its common name. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers with five petals that are often adorned with a distinctive central mark. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical characteristics make it a notable species within the Ranunculaceae family.
